bgeo

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • bgeo.Line

  • public class Line
extends Object
    A class to handle basic 2D geometry operations related to lines. These operations include division in equal parts, distances and squared distances to points, lines and circles and the the calculation of intersection points between two lines and a line and a circle.
    Author:
    ale

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      PVector a
      The first point of the segment.

      • intersect

        public PVector intersect(float ax,
                float ay,
                float bx,
                float by)
        Calculates the intersection point with another line segment
        Parameters:
        ax - x-coordinate of the beginning of the other segment.
        ay - y-coordinate of the beginning of the other segment.
        bx - x-coordinate of the ending of the other segment.
        by - y-coordinate of the ending of the other segment.
        Returns:
        Intersection point if both lines intersect. null in case there's no intersection.

                           float cy,
                           float r)
        Calculates the intersection point with a circle.
        Parameters:
        cx - x-coordinate of the center of the circle.
        cy - y-coordinate of the center of the circle.
        r - Radius of the circle.
        Returns:
        Arraylist of intersection points. Null If there is no intersection.

        by - y-coordinate of the end of the segment
        Returns:

      • intersect

        public static PVector intersect(float ax,
                float ay,
                float bx,
                float by,
                float cx,
                float cy,
                float dx,
                float dy)
        Calculates the intersection point of two line segments
        Parameters:
        ax - x-coordinate of the beginning of the first segment.
        ay - y-coordinate of the beginning of the first segment.
        bx - x-coordinate of the ending of the first segment.
        by - y-coordinate of the ending of the first segment.
        cx - x-coordinate of the beginning of the second segment.
        cy - y-coordinate of the beginning of the second segment.
        dx - x-coordinate of the ending of the second segment.
        dy - y-coordinate of the ending of the second segment.
        Returns:
        Intersection point if both lines intersect. Null in case there's no intersection.

      • distanceToCenter

        public static float distanceToCenter(float x1,
                     float y1,
                     float x2,
                     float y2,
                     float cx,
                     float cy,
                     float r)
        Calculates the minimum distance between a segment and the center of a circle
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of the first point of the segment.
        y1 - y-coordinate of the first point of the segment.
        x2 - x-coordinate of the second point of the segment.
        y2 - y-coordinate of the second point of the segment.
        cx - x-coordinate of the center of the circle.
        cy - y-coordinate of the center of the circle.
        r - Radius of the circle.
        Returns:
        Distance between the segment and the center of the circle.

        cx - x-coordinate of the center of the circle.
        cy - y-coordinate of the center of the circle.
        r - Radius of the circle.
        Returns:
        Squared distance between the segment and the center of the circle.

        public static ArrayList<PVector> intersect(float x1,
                           float y1,
                           float x2,
                           float y2,
                           float cx,
                           float cy,
                           float r)
        This method calculates the intersection points between a segment and a circle
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of the first point of the segment.
        y1 - y-coordinate of the first point of the segment.
        x2 - x-coordinate of the second point of the segment.

        cy - y-coordinate of the center of the circle.
        r - Radius of the circle.
        Returns:
